alert.note: Alert for Coachella Valley; San Gorgonio Pass Near Banning (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Hydrologic Outlook issued December 23 at 7:04PM PST by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...Significant flow expected in the Whitewater River and the Coachella Storm Water Channel expected late tonight and Friday... Heavy rain is impacting the mountains of San Bernardino County this evening with totals of 2 to 3 inches having already occurred. Heavy rainfall will continue across the mountains through the night tonight and spread across the northern part of the Coachella Valley later tonight into Friday morning. This rainfall will lead to significant run off into the Whitewater River wash. Rainfall totals of 4 to 8 inches are expected over the mountain slopes by Friday morning...with totals of 1 to 3 inches expected across the lower elevations. As the soils become saturated and runoff accelerates off the San Bernardino Mountains...significant flows will develop in the Whitewater River. These flows may reach Palm Springs Friday morning...and flow southward through the Coachella Valley to Indio and beyond during the day. The flow will impact low-water crossings and may create dangerous swift-water areas through the valley. The rain will diminish Friday afternoon...but some flow will likely continue in the canal through Friday night. Residents should be prepared for road closures and listen for later advisories.

area.areaDesc: Coachella Valley; San Gorgonio Pass Near Banning
